Feature.Name: ADCertificateServicesRole
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Active Directory Certificate Services role

Feature.Name: BITS
Feature.Description: Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) asynchronously transfers files in the foreground or background, controls the flow of the transfers to preserve the responsiveness of other network applications, and automatically resumes file transfers after disconnecting from the network or restarting the computer.

Feature.Name: BiometricFramework
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Windows Biometric Framework

Feature.Name: CCFFilter
Feature.Description: Support component for Continuous Availability

Feature.Name: CertificateServices
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Certification Authority Service

Feature.Name: Client-DeviceLockdown
Feature.Description: Services and tools to provide a controlled and specialized experience for the end user of a device

Feature.Name: Client-EmbeddedBootExp
Feature.Description: Suppresses Windows elements that appear when Windows starts, resumes or encounters unrecovered errors

Feature.Name: Client-EmbeddedLogon
Feature.Description: Enables customized logon experiences

Feature.Name: Client-EmbeddedShellLauncher
Feature.Description: Launches an alternate shell instead of the default Windows shell

Feature.Name: Client-KeyboardFilter
Feature.Description: Enables controls to suppress undesirable key presses or key combinations

Feature.Name: Client-UnifiedWriteFilter
Feature.Description: Install services and tools to protects physical media from write operations

Feature.Name: Containers
Feature.Description: Provides services and tools to create and manage Windows Server Containers and their resources.

Feature.Name: DHCPServer
Feature.Description: DHCP Server feature

Feature.Name: DNS-Server-Full-Role
Feature.Description: This installs the DNS Server.

Feature.Name: DSC-Service
Feature.DisplayName: Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Service
Feature.Description: Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Service supports configuration management of multiple nodes from a single repository.

Feature.Name: DataCenterBridging
Feature.Description: IEEE Data Center Bridging

Feature.Name: DeviceHealthAttestationService
Feature.Description: Device Health Attestation Language Pack

Feature.Name: DiskIo-QoS
Feature.Description: Allows configuration of I/O quality-of-service settings such as maximum IO and bandwidth limits on applications.

Feature.Name: EnhancedStorage
Feature.Description: Enhanced Storage enables support for accessing additional functions made available by Enhanced Storage devices. Enhanced Storage devices have built-in safety features that let you control who can access the data on the device.

Feature.Name: BitLocker
Feature.Description: Provides full volume disk encryption for both boot volumes and data volumes.

Feature.Name: FRS-Infrastructure
Feature.Description: Allows files to be automatically copied and maintained simultaneously on multiple servers.

Feature.Name: FabricShieldedTools
Feature.DisplayName: VM Shielding Tools for Fabric Management
Feature.Description: Provides Shielded VM utilities that are used by Fabric Management solutions and should be installed on the Fabric Management server.

Feature.Name: FailoverCluster-AdminPak
Feature.Description: Provides the Failover Cluster Manager snap-in, the Cluster-Aware Updating interface, and the Failover Cluster module for Windows PowerShell.

Feature.Name: FailoverCluster-AutomationServer
Feature.Description: Provides the cluster Component Object Model (COM) programmatic interface, MSClus.

Feature.Name: FailoverCluster-CmdInterface
Feature.Description: Provides the deprecated cluster.exe command-line tool for Failover Clustering.

Feature.Name: FailoverCluster-FullServer
Feature.Description: Provides the full set of components to run and maintain a cluster.

Feature.Name: FailoverCluster-PowerShell
Feature.DisplayName: Failover Cluster Module for Windows PowerShell
Feature.Description: Provides Windows PowerShell cmdlets for managing failover clusters. It also includes the Cluster-Aware Updating module for Windows PowerShell, for installing software updates on failover clusters.

Feature.Name: CoreFileServer
Feature.Description: File Server Role

Feature.Name: DFSN-Server
Feature.Description: Integrates disparate file shares into a single, logical namespace and manages these logical volumes

Feature.Name: DFSR-Infrastructure-ServerEdition
Feature.Description: Replicates files among multiple PCs keeping them in sync.

Feature.Name: Dedup-Core
Feature.Description: Reduces the amount of physical storage required for data by applying chunk-level deduplication and compression

Feature.Name: FileServerVSSAgent
Feature.Description: Enables Create File Share Shadow Copy on remote file server.

Feature.Name: SMBHashGeneration
Feature.Description: Network file hash generation for branch caching

Feature.Name: WorkFolders-Server
Feature.Description: Work Folders provides a way to use work files from a variety of computers, including work and personal devices. You can use Work Folders to host user files and keep them synchronized - whether users access their files from inside the network or from across the Internet.

Feature.Name: iSCSITargetServer
Feature.Description: Provides component and managment tools for an iSCSI Target.

Feature.Name: HardenedFabricEncryptionTask
Feature.Description: Adds or removes the Hardened Fabric task that encrypts existing disks

Feature.Name: IIS-HostableWebCore
Feature.DisplayName: Internet Information Services Hostable Web Core
Feature.Description: Program your application to serve HTTP requests by using core IIS functionality.

Feature.Name: IIS-WebServerRole
Feature.Description: Internet Information Services provides support for Web and FTP servers, along with support for dynamic content such as Classic ASP and CGI, and local management.

Feature.Name: IIS-FTPServer
Feature.Description: Enable your server to transfer files by using the FTP protocol.

Feature.Name: IIS-FTPExtensibility
Feature.Description: Customize FTP publishing by writing your own software extensions.

Feature.Name: IIS-FTPSvc
Feature.Description: Enable FTP publishing on a Web server.

Feature.Name: IIS-WebServer
Feature.Description: Installs the IIS World Wide Web Services. Provides support for HTML web sites and optional support for Classic ASP, and web server extensions.

Feature.Name: IIS-ApplicationDevelopment
Feature.Description: Install Web server application development features

Feature.Name: IIS-ASP
Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host Classic ASP applications

Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host ASP.NET 3.5 applications

Feature.Name: IIS-ASPNET45
Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host ASP.NET v4.x applications

Feature.Name: IIS-ApplicationInit
Feature.Description: Application Initialization perform expensive web application initialization tasks before serving web pages.

Feature.Name: IIS-CGI
Feature.Description: Enable support for CGI executables

Feature.Description: Allow ISAPI extensions to handle client requests

Feature.Name: RPC-HTTP_Proxy
Feature.Description: Proxy used for relaying RPC over HTTP traffic

Feature.Name: IIS-ISAPIFilter
Feature.Description: Allow ISAPI filters to modify Web server behavior

Feature.Name: IIS-NetFxExtensibility
Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host .NET Framework 3.5 applications

Feature.Name: IIS-NetFxExtensibility45
Feature.Description: Enable your Web server to host .NET Framework v4.x applications

Feature.Name: IIS-ServerSideIncludes
Feature.Description: Serve .stm, .shtm, and .shtml files from a Web site

Feature.Name: IIS-WebSockets
Feature.Description: IIS and ASP.NET 4.x support writing server applications that communicate over the WebSocket Protocol.

Feature.Name: IIS-CommonHttpFeatures
Feature.Description: Installs support for Web server content such as HTML and image files.

Feature.Name: IIS-DefaultDocument
Feature.Description: Allows you to specify a default file to be loaded when users do not specify a file in a request URL

Feature.Name: IIS-DirectoryBrowsing
Feature.Description: Allow clients to see the contents of a directory on your Web server

Feature.Name: IIS-HttpErrors
Feature.Description: Allows you to customize the error messages returned to clients

Feature.Name: IIS-HttpRedirect
Feature.Description: Redirect client requests to a specific destination

Feature.Name: IIS-StaticContent
Feature.Description: Serve .htm, .html, and image files from a Web site

Feature.Name: BITSExtensions-Upload
Feature.DisplayName: Background Intelligent Transfer Service (BITS) Server Extensions for File Upload
Feature.Description: Adds or removes BITS Server Extensions for File Upload from the system

Feature.Name: ManagementOdata
Feature.Description: Management OData IIS Extension is a framework for easily exposing Windows PowerShell cmdlets through an ODATA-based web service running under IIS. After enabling this feature, the user must provide a schema file (which contains definitions of the resources to be exposed) and an implementation of callback interfaces to make the web service functional.

Feature.Name: Microsoft-Windows-Web-Services-for-Management-IIS-Extension
Feature.Description: Windows Remote Management (WinRM) IIS Extension enables a server to receive a management request from a client by using WS-Management. WinRM is the Microsoft implementation of the WS-Management protocol which provides a secure way to communicate with local and remote computers by using Web services.

Feature.Name: NetworkDeviceEnrollmentServices
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Network Device Enrollment Services

Feature.Name: OnlineRevocationServices
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Online Revocation Service

Feature.Name: WebEnrollmentServices
Feature.Description: Adds or removes Web Enrollment Services

Feature.Description: Publish and manage files on a Web server by using the HTTP protocol.

Feature.Name: IIS-HealthAndDiagnostics
Feature.Description: Enables you to monitor and manage server, site, and application health

Feature.Name: IIS-CustomLogging
Feature.Description: Enable support for custom logging for Web servers, sites, and applications

Feature.Name: IIS-HttpLogging
Feature.Description: Enables logging of Web site activity for this server

Feature.Name: IIS-HttpTracing
Feature.Description: Enable tracing for ASP.NET applications and failed requests

Feature.Name: IIS-LoggingLibraries

Feature.Name: IIS-ODBCLogging
Feature.Description: Enable support for logging to an ODBC-compliant database.

Feature.Name: IIS-BasicAuthentication
Feature.Description: Require a valid Windows user name and password for connection.

Feature.Name: IIS-CertProvider

Feature.Name: IIS-ClientCertificateMappingAuthentication
Feature.Description: Authenticate client certificates with Active Directory accounts.

Feature.Description: Authenticate clients by sending a password hash to a Windows domain controller.

Feature.Name: IIS-IISCertificateMappingAuthentication

Feature.Description: Install the IIS 6.0 Management Console. Provides support for administration of remote IIS 6.0 servers from this computer.

Feature.Name: LightweightServer
Feature.Description: Adds or removes BITS Compact Server

Feature.Name: MSMQ
Feature.Description: Message Queuing provides guaranteed message delivery, efficient routing, security, and priority-based messaging between applications. Message Queuing also accommodates message delivery between applications that run on different operating systems, use dissimilar network infrastructures, are temporarily offline, or that are running at different times.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-Services
Feature.Description: Message Queuing Services provides guaranteed message delivery, efficient routing, security, and priority-based messaging between applications. Message Queuing also accommodates message delivery between applications that run on different operating systems, use dissimilar network infrastructures, are temporarily offline, or that are running at different times.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-Server
Feature.Description: Microsoft Message Queue (MSMQ) Server.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-ADIntegration
Feature.DisplayName: MSMQ Active Directory Domain Services Integration
Feature.Description: Active Directory Domain Services Integration feature enables publishing of queue properties to Active Directory Domain Services, out-of-the-box authentication and encryption of messages using certificates registered in Active Directory Domain Services, and routing of messages across Windows sites. This feature becomes operational only when the computer joins a domain.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-HTTP
Feature.Description: The HTTP Support feature allows you to expose a queue to the internet such that applications can send messages to the queue using HTTP protocol. This feature requires Internet Information Server.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-Multicast
Feature.Description: The Multicast support feature enables you to send messages to a Multicast IPAddress. Queues can be associated with a Multicast IPAddress. Messages sent to a Multicast IPAddress will be delivered to the queues that are associated with that IPAddress.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-RoutingServer
Feature.Description: The Routing Service feature enables you to route messages between different sites and within a site.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-Triggers
Feature.Description: Message Queue Triggers enables the invocation of a COM component or an executable depending on the filters that you define for the incoming messages in a given queue.

Feature.Name: MSMQ-DCOMProxy
Feature.Description: The DCOM proxy feature enables MSMQ applications to use MSMQ DCOM API to connect to a remote MSMQ Server.

Feature.Name: MSRDC-Infrastructure
Feature.Description: Installs Remote Differential Compression (RDC) support for use in third-party applications.

Feature.Name: MediaPlayback
Feature.Description: Controls media features such as Windows Media Player and Windows Media Center.

Feature.Description: Media Foundation, which includes Windows Media Foundation, the Windows Media Format SDK, and a server subset of DirectShow, provides the infrastructure required for applications and services to transcode, analyze, and generate thumbnails for media files. Media Foundation is required by the Desktop Experience.

Feature.Name: ServerMigration
Feature.Description: Server Migration Tools

Feature.Name: ServicesForNFS-ServerAndClient
Feature.Description: Allows you to access and share files using the Network File System (NFS) protocol.

Feature.Name: ClientForNFS-Infrastructure
Feature.Description: Enables this computer to gain access to files on UNIX-based computers

Feature.Name: ServerForNFS-Infrastructure
Feature.Description: Enables this computer to share files with UNIX-based computers

Feature.Name: SimpleTCP
Feature.DisplayName: Simple TCPIP services (i.e. echo, daytime etc)
Feature.Description: Install Simple TCPIP services

Feature.Name: SmbDirect
Feature.Description: Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) support for the SMB 3.x file sharing protocol

Feature.Name: SmbWitness
Feature.Description: Support component for Continuous Availability

Feature.Name: Storage-Replica-AdminPack
Feature.DisplayName: Storage Replica Module for Windows PowerShell
Feature.Description: CIM provider and Windows PowerShell module for managing Storage Replica on local and remote computers

Feature.Name: TFTP
Feature.Description: Transfer files using the Trivial File Transfer Protocol

Feature.Name: TIFFIFilter
Feature.Description: Enables the indexing and searching of Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) files using Optical Character Recognition (OCR).

Feature.Name: TelnetClient
Feature.Description: Allows you to connect to other computers remotely.

Feature.Name: UpdateServices
Feature.Description: Windows Server Update Services allows network administrators to specify the Microsoft updates that should be installed, create separate groups of computers for different sets of updates, and get reports on the compliance levels of the computers and the updates that must be installed.

Feature.Name: UpdateServices-RSAT
Feature.Description: Windows Server Update Services Tools includes graphical and Powershell tools for managing WSUS.

Feature.Name: UpdateServices-API
Feature.Description: Installs the .NET API and PowerShell cmdlets for remote management, automated task creation, and managing WSUS from the command line.

Feature.Name: UpdateServices-Services
Feature.Description: Installs the services used by Windows Server Update Services: Update Service, the Reporting Web Service, the API Remoting Web Service, the Client Web Service, the Simple Web Authentication Web Service, the Server Synchronization Service, and the DSS Authentication Web Service.

Feature.Name: UpdateServices-Database
Feature.Description: Installs the feature that enables WSUS to connect to a Microsoft SQL Server database.

Feature.Name: VolumeActivation-Full-Role
Feature.Description: This installs Volume Activation Services

Feature.Name: WAS-WindowsActivationService
Feature.Description: Install Windows Process Activation Service

Feature.Name: WAS-ConfigurationAPI
Feature.Description: Install managed code configuration APIs

Feature.Name: WAS-NetFxEnvironment
Feature.Description: Install the .NET Environment for supporting managed code activation

Feature.Name: WAS-ProcessModel
Feature.Description: Install Process Model for the Windows Process Activation Service

Feature.Name: WINSRuntime
Feature.Description: Adds or removes the Windows Internet Name Service - Runtime

Feature.Name: WebDAV-Redirector
Feature.Description: Enables Windows-based programs to create, access, and modify Internet-based files.

Feature.Name: Windows-Defender
Feature.Description: Windows Defender helps protect your machine from malware.

Feature.Name: Windows-Defender-Features
Feature.Description: Windows Defender helps protect your machine from malware.

Feature.Name: Windows-Identity-Foundation
Feature.Description: Windows Identity Foundation (WIF) 3.5 is a set of .NET Framework classes that can be used for implementing claims-based identity in your .NET 3.5 and 4.0 applications. WIF 3.5 has been superseded by WIF classes that are provided as part of .NET 4.5. It is recommended that you use .NET 4.5 for supporting claims-based identity in your applications.

Feature.Name: Windows-Internal-Database
Feature.Description: Installs Windows Internal Database Component

Feature.Name: IPAMServerFeature
Feature.Description: Adds or removes the IP Address Management Feature

Feature.Name: UpdateServices-WidDatabase
Feature.Description: Installs the database used by WSUS into WID.

Feature.Name: WindowsServerBackup
Feature.Description: Windows Server Backup allows backup and recovery of OS state, files and folders, and application data on protected server

Feature.Name: WindowsStorageManagementService
Feature.Description: Windows Standards-Based Storage Management provides the ability to discover, manage, and monitor storage devices using management interfaces that conform to the SMI-S standard. This functionality is exposed as a set of Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) classes and Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

Feature.Name: WirelessNetworking
Feature.Description: Microsoft Windows Wireless Networking feature

Feature.Name: Xps-Foundation-Xps-Viewer
Feature.Description: Allows you to read, copy, print, sign, and set permissions for XPS documents

Feature.Name: iSCSITargetStorageProviders
Feature.Description: Provides support components for disks supplied by the Microsoft iSCSI Target.

Feature.Name: iSNS_Service
Feature.Description: Install iSNS Server service
